message.content: This question requires knowledge of animal adaptations to different environments. In unusually hot and dry places, such as deserts, the animal that is most likely to thrive is the fennec fox. Fennec foxes are adapted to living in desert environments and have several special features that help them survive. They have large ears, which help them dissipate heat and stay cool, and they have fur that helps insulate them from the extreme desert temperatures. Jellyfish (option A) are marine animals and cannot survive in hot and dry environments. Arctic foxes (option B) and polar bears (option D) are adapted to cold environments, not hot and dry ones.

This question requires basic knowledge about the adaptations of different animals to their environments. In unusually hot and dry places, such as deserts, the fennec fox is known to thrive. Fennec foxes have adaptations that allow them to survive in these extreme conditions, such as large ears that help dissipate heat and their ability to go long periods without water. Option (A) is incorrect because jellyfish are aquatic animals and cannot thrive in hot and dry environments. Option (B) is incorrect because arctic foxes are adapted to cold, arctic environments and would not thrive in hot and dry places. Option (D) is incorrect because polar bears are adapted to cold, icy, and marine environments.
